intro: Arctotis pilifera, commonly known as the hairyleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Arctotis pilifera is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
